oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bridging Drought – Resilience in Rangeland Management in Times of Climate Change
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Isele, Judith
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
Animal husbandry
Soil
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic livestock farming in semiarid regions greatly depends on the sustainable management of the natural rangeland as the resource for livestock sustenance. High stock density in combination with short grazing and long recovery periods achieve effective rainfall utilisation and considerably higher fodder production resulting in a high degree of resilience in drought situations.
